description:
Toxoplasma gondii is a unicellular, obligate intracellular parasite that belongs to the phylum Apicomplexa. The specific strain mentioned, Toxoplasma gondii TgCATBr9, is a genotype of this parasite that has been isolated from a domestic cat in Brazil.

Toxoplasma gondii is known for its complex life cycle, which involves both sexual and asexual stages. The TgCATBr9 strain is a member of the type II lineage, which is the most common genotype found in human infections worldwide.

This parasite is capable of infecting a wide range of warm-blooded vertebrate hosts, including humans, and can cause the disease toxoplasmosis. The TgCATBr9 strain has been the subject of various research studies to better understand its genetic characteristics, pathogenicity, and potential impact on human and animal health.
